title: Tottenham 1-1 Watford: Dele Alli rescues late point for the hosts before VAR confusion
text:
Advertisement

Tottenham salvaged a late point in their home clash against Watford when Dele Alli converted beyond Ben Foster following lengthy VAR intervention.

The England star had latched on to poor handling from Foster to tuck home from a tight angle before confusion ensued as officials checked the goal.

The Watford star was on hand to bury Daryl Janmaat's inviting delivery into the penalty area beyond Paulo Gazzaniga after only six minutes, after Craig Cathcart's superb cross-field pass picked out the Dutch full back.

Son Heung-min was introduced at half-time for the hosts and came closest to levelling, but his superb race towards the Watford back line ended with a powerful effort cracking against the woodwork.

More to follow.

Dele Alli tucked home a late equaliser for Tottenham in their home clash against Waford before lengthy intervention from VAR

The goal had initially appeared to be chalked off when the big screen at the stadium had incorrectly stated 'no goal'

The England star pounced on sloppy handling from Watford stopper Ben Foster to fire home from a tight angle

Tempers flared in the wake of the equaliser after the confusion caused by VAR initially appeared to have ruled out Alli's goal

Abdoulaye Doucoure's first-half strike had piled the pressure on struggling Tottenham and manager Mauricio Pochettino

Doucoure had latched on to Daryl Janmaat's delivery into the box to fire inside the far post and beyond Paulo Gazzaniga

The French midfielder timed his run from a deep position to perfection to hand the visitors the lead in North London

MATCH FACTS AND LEAGUE TABLE Tottenham: Gazzaniga, Sanchez (Son 46), Alderweireld, Vertonghen, Aurier, Winks (Ndombele 70), Sissoko, Rose, Alli, Lucas (Lamela 63), Kane Unused substitutes: Austin, Dier, Foyth, Davies Scorers: Alli 86 Booked: Sanchez, Sissoko, Rose, Alli Watford: Foster, Janmaat (Femenia 71), Cathcart, Dawson, Kabasele, Holebas, Cleverley, Chalobah, Doucoure, Pereyra (Hughes 84), Welbeck (Deulofeu 4) Unused substitutes: Gomes, Masina, Gray, Sarr Scorers: Doucoure 6 Booked: Holebas, Femenia Season at a glance Live tables

Doucoure (left) and Tom Cleverley (right) wheeled away in celebration after shocking the home crowd at the stadium

Spurs' stuttering start to the season took another turn for the worse when Doucoure buried his effort from a matter of yards

Watford frontman Danny Welbeck managed just three minutes before being replaced after suffering a hamstring injury

The former Arsenal and Manchester United striker has suffered from a plague of injuries throughout the last few seasons

Watford's opener once again placed the spotlight on Tottenham boss Pochettino following a torrid start to the new season

Spurs captain Harry Kane endured an isolated first-half for the hosts, who had struggled to carve out openings to equalise

Son Heung-min was introduced at the half-time interval as Tottenham attempted to salvage a result against the Hornets
description: SAMI MOKBEL AT TOTTENHAM HOTSPUR STADIUM: Tottenham salvaged a late point in their home clash against Watford when Dele Alli converted beyond Ben Foster.
